text: Focus sprints boost deep work with short, intense intervals.
Pick one task and remove distractions before you start.
Set a timer for 20–25 minutes of single‑task focus.
Silence notifications and close extra tabs.
Work with intent; capture stray thoughts on a notepad.
When the timer ends, take a 3–5 minute active break.
Evaluate progress and adjust your next sprint.
Stack 2–3 sprints to build momentum without burnout.
